name: Acoustic Sessions
description: An evening at ️ EartH Hackney. A restored 1930s art deco cinema with soaring ceilings and ornate details. Now hosting live music from indie to Afrobeat.

name: DJ Set
description: An evening at ️ EartH Hackney. A restored 1930s art deco cinema with soaring ceilings and ornate details. Now hosting live music from indie to Afrobeat.

name: Live Music Night
description: An evening at Oslo Hackney. A café by day, gig venue by night, tucked under railway arches. Hosts indie darlings, folk acts, and late-night DJ sets.

name: New Writing Showcase
description: An evening at King's Head Theatre. Britain's first pub theatre, tucked above a Victorian boozer. Hosting musicals, comedy, and new writing with charm and wit.

name: Devised Theatre
description: An evening at King's Head Theatre. Britain's first pub theatre, tucked above a Victorian boozer. Hosting musicals, comedy, and new writing with charm and wit.

name: Band Showcase
description: An evening at Hootananny Brixton. A laidback Victorian boozer steeped in Brixton’s musical lifeblood — from reggae and ska to global fusion bands.

name: Poetry Reading
description: An evening at Bush Hall. Once a ballroom, then a WWII soup kitchen, now a gleaming indie music hall with chandeliers and rock history.

name: Acoustic Sessions
description: An evening at ️ The Tabernacle. An old church turned creative sanctuary — home to Caribbean Carnival legends, art exhibitions, jazz, spoken word and film.

name: Folk Acoustic Set
description: An evening at The Viaduct. A coaching inn since 1737, now famed for Bearcat Comedy Nights in its upstairs hall.

name: One-Act Plays
description: An evening at Jacksons Lane. A converted church hosting circus, dance, aerial work, and movement-based performance. Joyful, inventive, gravity-defying.

name: Theatre Performance
description: An evening at ️ Ace Cafe London. The world’s most famous motor café — petrolheads, live rock’n’roll, and a rebellious edge.

name: Theatre Performance
description: An evening at Bethnal Green Working Men's Club. A faded East End social club reborn as London's queer cabaret heart. Sequins, sweat, disco balls, and absolute joy.

name: Comedy Night
description: An evening at Bethnal Green Working Men's Club. A faded East End social club reborn as London's queer cabaret heart. Sequins, sweat, disco balls, and absolute joy.

name: Comedy Night
description: An evening at Roundhouse. A vast Victorian engine shed turned iconic music venue. Circular, industrial, unforgettable. Home to legends and future legends alike.

name: Comedy Night
description: An evening at Roundhouse. A vast Victorian engine shed turned iconic music venue. Circular, industrial, unforgettable. Home to legends and future legends alike.

name: DJ Set
description: An evening at Matchstick Piehouse. Under the railway arches, this not-for-profit art cave cooks up experimental theatre, comedy, and live music — with actual pies on the side.

name: Poetry Reading
description: An evening at Matchstick Piehouse. Under the railway arches, this not-for-profit art cave cooks up experimental theatre, comedy, and live music — with actual pies on the side.

name: One-Act Plays
description: An evening at Finborough Theatre. A West London legend perched above a classic boozer, staging hard-hitting new plays and overlooked gems. Proudly fringe and famously fierce.

name: One-Act Plays
description: An evening at The Sebright Arms. A scruffy East End boozer with a scrappy theatre upstairs. Comedy, drag, experimental one-acts — often brilliant, sometimes baffling.

name: Devised Theatre
description: An evening at Hackney Empire. A gilded Victorian music hall dripping in red velvet and gold leaf. Hosts everything from stand-up to panto, opera to hip-hop theatre.

name: New Writing Showcase
description: An evening at Hackney Empire. A gilded Victorian music hall dripping in red velvet and gold leaf. Hosts everything from stand-up to panto, opera to hip-hop theatre.
